name: Mohammed Al-Marshudi
title: Application Engineer, Operations
shortBio: Omani software engineer and Application Engineer at Vodafone Oman. Building backend APIs, web and mobile apps, and ETL pipelines in Muscat, Oman. Full stack developer specializing in Python, FastAPI, React, and TypeScript.
longBio:
I'm Mohammed Amour Al-Marshudi, a software engineer from Oman who believes technology should solve real problems, not just exist for its own sake. I graduated from the University of Technology and Applied Sciences in January 2025 with a degree in Software Engineering. My journey with technology started long before that. I've always been the person who asks 'how does this work?' and then spends hours figuring it out.

I'm drawn to the intersection of automation and impact. At Vodafone Oman, I started as an IT & Data Automation intern where I discovered the satisfaction of turning hours of manual work into something that runs in seconds. Now as an Application Engineer, I architect backend services that power enterprise applications. The problems are bigger, the stakes are higher, and I love every challenge that comes with it.

I'm an entrepreneur at heart. I've co-founded ventures like WebKanZ (a travel experience platform), Kawkaban Farm (a farm-stay booking system), and DoduHash (a billing automation SaaS). These projects taught me that shipping something imperfect is infinitely better than planning something perfect that never sees the light of day.
keywords: University of Technology and Applied Sciences
highlights: Strong focus on reliability, automation, observability, and scalable architecture
Experience building and operating internal telecom platforms
Background in data automation and ETL pipelines
